summary: This is an email chain between FBI personnel discussing the review of video footage in the DCAP system related to an investigation. The emails detail progress on tagging 3,662 videos with motion, categorizing them as 'file of interest' or 'reviewed'.

persons.name: Operational Support Technician C20 & C11, NYO
persons.context: An FBI technician working on reviewing video footage in the DCAP system, tagging videos as 'file of interest' or 'reviewed'.

events.title: DCAP Review Initiation
events.description: An FBI technician begins reviewing video footage in the DCAP system, filtering for videos with motion and tagging them.
personsInvolved: Operational Support Technician C20 & C11, NYO

events.title: DCAP Review Completion
events.description: An FBI technician reports completing the review of all 3,662 videos with motion in the DCAP system.
personsInvolved: Operational Support Technician C20 & C11, NYO

locations: NYO (New York Office of the FBI)
keyFacts: FBI personnel reviewed 3,662 videos with motion in the DCAP system as part of an investigation.
Videos were tagged as either 'file of interest' or 'reviewed' based on their significance.
The review process involved filtering for media type (video) and relationship (has motion).
The email chain indicates coordinated efforts between FBI and possibly NYPD personnel (implied by NYPD in address fields).
The DCAP portal experienced technical issues, causing crashes during the review process.
